* Does not show when I stop following things (if it's going to show me when I start, why not the opposite, though it would be nice to be able to configure it not to show this at all though). I'm not sure this is a bug on its own, or related to the delay between creating a new project (and automatically following it), and the changing the follow status before the home page has been updated with the newly followed project (the time taken for this to happen is probably a separate bug).

j'ai remarqué que quelques talents démoniste bug et ne marche pas comme il faut, ces talents sont :

* "allonge de destruction" ==> pas de réduction menace
* "domination corrompue" ==> ca ne réduit pas le temps d'incantation comme il faut si on lance l'invocation après 2-3 sec.
* tous les démons ne tapent pas comme il faut, en moyenne 300 au lieu de 1000 (comme sur offi) (et comme les autres familiers du chasseur par exemple)
* "diablotin surpuissant" ==> 100% chance de coup critique ne marche pas
* tout type du sort peur (démoniste, prêtre, guerrier) bug :  ce n'est pas dégressif et ca dure 20sec au lieu de 9 sec maximum pour le démoniste et 6sec pour le prêtre et le guerrier.\\

voila pour le moment en attendant que ces talents soient debug, merci et bon travail.

fields.description:
Hi,\\
can you move ENCODING = 'cp1252' to Drawing class?\\
This let me change default drawing encoding and write text in my encoding:

from dxfwrite import DXFEngine as dxf\\
drawing = dxf.drawing('test.dxf')\\
drawing.ENCODING='cp1251'\\
drawing.add_layer('LINES')\\
drawing.add(dxf.text(u'_тест_', (0,0,0), 5))\\
drawing.save()

P.S. See attachments for changes.\\
Best regards,\\
banza.\\
mailto:banza@i.ua
fields.summary: how to set another drawing encoding

fields.description:
When a changeset is too large to all be displayed on the page, you get this message:

//This changeset can not be displayed, as it is too large (cutoff was at 147.4 KB).//

In the list of changed files, each file is still linked to an anchor tag on the page that doesn't exist (because it was too large to display). So then the only way to see the diff is to manually browse to that file and select the diff to view.

Instead, the link should take you to the source view for that file, showing the diff of that changeset vs. its parent.

If a changeset is too large to show it all on the one page, make those links useful and take you directly to the diff for that file. If it isn't too big, have the links function as before, linking to anchors.
fields.summary: Allow users to view individual items when the full changeset view is too big (BB-2941)

fields.description:
In the default wiki stylesheet, headings H3 and below are about the same size as normal text -- and much smaller than H2.

Examples:\\
== I am header 1 ==\\
Normal text\\
=== I am header 2 ===\\
Normal text\\
==== I am header 3 ====\\
Normal text\\
===== I am header 4 ====\\
Normal text

...oddly the issue tracker seems to be using a slightly different header style -- it's worse in the wiki than it is here, because in the wiki H3 isn't even bold.
fields.summary: Default stylesheet makes headings H3 and below too small.

fields.description:

Best regards,\\
jim

fields.description:

PS: Sorry for my bad english.

I was forking pip repo and my fork came with the wrong revision. The tip (in pip) is a close branch, and the fork comes with that branch's source. Look:\\
{{{\\
$ hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/ianb/pip\\
destination directory: pip\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 793 changesets with 1289 changes to 111 files (+3 heads)\\
updating to branch default\\
86 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
$ ls pip\\
contrib  docs  MANIFEST.in  pip  setup.cfg  setup.py  tests

h1. now comes the fork part
h1. I just forked the repo
$ hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/hltbra/pip pip-hltbra\\
requesting all changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 535 changesets with 804 changes to 86 files\\
updating to branch default\\
70 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved\\
$ ls pip-hltbra/\\
docs  MANIFEST.in  pip  regen-docs  scripts  setup.py  tests\\
$\\
}}}

fields.description:
Hi,

I wanted to commit my .vim files to bitbucket.... perhaps too fast. Anyway, I named the repository .vim (same directory name) and now bitbucket can't access it. Perhaps the problem is with mercurial. Anyhow, if it can't be accessed, there should be a way to delete it?

*project/wiki/An Example*

If I manually enter a space in the page title and then create that page, it considers the space a *%20*.

If instead I link a page with a space, such as *[[An Example]]*, it will convert the space to underscore instead, actually linking to *An_Example* instead.

I hope that's not intentional.

The TOC macro requires balanced equal signs in the heading, but this is not required by the Creole 1.0 syntax spec.\\
The heading is rendered properly in the page, but it does not show up in the TOC.

For an example, see:

http://bitbucket.org/marijnvanderzee/build-wiki/wiki/Bugs/BalancedClosingEqualSignsAreRequiredByTocMacro

This is not a big problem - if you know it.\\
If you don't know it then you are wondering what you are doing wrong. The first place you'll look is at how you use the {{{<<toc>}}} macro. Since that is the wrong place to look, it gets frustrating quickly.

Because the heading renders properly in the wiki page, you assume your markup can't be the problem.
fields.summary: TOC macro requires balanced equal signs in headers

fields.description:
I use the service broker to integrate Bitbucket with Lighthouse, and it is usually wonderful…except sometimes when the occasional changeset fails to show up in Lighthouse. This can be problematic when one uses commit message keywords to track ticket states.

Of course, since I can’t monitor the traffic between the services, I have no idea where the problem lies (with you, or with them), and since it is an _occasional_ issue it is not easy to reproduce.

In case it helps, an example of a changeset that failed to show up in Lighthouse was https://bitbucket.org/erezlife/erezlife/changeset/850971b64d20 (n.b. private repo). With luck you have logs to track this; if not, well, I would very much like to provide more helpful info but I don’t know how to reproduce it!

Another example: http://bitbucket.org/erezlife/erezlife/changeset/774c2d328a4b
fields.summary: Lighthouse service sometimes fails to update

When not logged in, if I try to access the url of one of my private repos, I get a message stating that I do not have access to that repo. By stating that I do not have access to that repo, information about the private repo (its name and confirmation of its existence) is being implicitly divulged. It seems it would be more secure to simply throw a 404 when trying to access a private repo without permission to do so.

I'm not trying to be a condescending dick, I love your service, but it seems reasonable to deny access to //any// piece of information associated with a private repository. Thanks for reading and I look forward to enjoying your fine service for a long time to come!

Derek

fields.description:
Messages that are sent without titles cannot be opened.  The link to open a message is applied to the message's title, and if the title is blank there obviously isn't a link to click.

Workaround:

Messages that are unread have a bullet point next to the blank title which can be clicked.  Therefore, new messages with blank titles can be read.  To re-read a previously opened message that has no title, mark it as unread to bring back the clickable bullet point.

Suggested fix:

Two possibilities.  Firstly, make it impossible to create a message without a title.  This is the best solution.  Alternatively, make the body text excerpt also a link, or add a "read" button next to the title somewhere.
fields.summary: Messages without title in Inbox cannot be opened (BB-718)

fields.description:
It appears that you forgot the strtolower when generating the gravatar URLs. I always enter my email address as Asa.Ayers@gmail.com, but my gravatar hash should be 7847898b393b37f7be8d714717a2c91e md5('asa.ayers@gmail.com')

http://en.gravatar.com/site/implement/hash/

fields.summary: Repository gives 503 error via the Web

fields.description:
Dear sir,

I've uploaded some sphinx documentation in the repository of my Rock-solid-tools wiki.

But for days now, maybe weeks or months, I've not been able to access these docs anymore :

the link found on\\
http://bitbucket.org/pchambon/python-rock-solid-tools/wiki/Home

which is : http://bytebucket.org/pchambon/python-rock-solid-tools/wiki/index.html

Now always gives an error :\\
"502 Bad Gateway\\
nginx/0.7.65"

Would it be possible to fix that server problem ? I need to have my docs online for my upcoming pyconfr talk.

Thanks,\\
Regards,\\
Pascal Chambon
I'm getting 502 Bad Gateway errors for the images on my wiki: http://bitbucket.org/svisser/palabra/wiki/Home - The images are not displayed and when going to an image's URL, it's a 502 error.

My repository has been down all weekend with the same Apache error page. Direct connections via the Mercurial client are also not working.

http://bitbucket.org/rawnsley/workspace

delete repository with openid account doesn't work because there is no password (but required)\\
ho can a repo be deleted when using openid?
fields.summary: delete repository with openid account doesn't work because there is no password (but required)

fields.description: dear bitbucket team, unfortunately the help link in the top navigation bar doesn't work...
Hi, i tried several times to reset my login password but i dont get the mail with the instructions.

Hi! I'm trying to reset my forgotten password using my Gmail address. After 2 hours of waiting there are nothing at all.\\
Email from other domains  to my account passed through without any troubles.\\
Can you help me?

I tried to reset password, but no mail arrived here.\\
My account is 'jtmr'.

Searching this tracker gave me an idea that you won't get the mail from bitbucket if the mail address you wrote on signing up was different from current one.\\
But I have no ways to change the address to initial one because I cannot sign in and that's why I post this, so it's no use...

I am unable to access the sites "Help". Clicking on the "Help" menu does not return anything.

Thanks.

I have a repository (jasulak/.emacs.d) that I can't administer, push to, or delete.  I assume the problem has something to do with the periods in the title.

Thanks,

-James

error: changegroup.csetlog hook raised an exception: 'NoneType' object has no at\\
tribute '_repo'

i was on\\
windows\\
Mercurial Distributed SCM (version 1.4.3)
The graphics canvas of the changesets view is out of the visible area.
fields.summary: Changesets graphics canvas does'nt show well.

fields.description:
I've noticed recently that viewing some files is actually showing contents and links for other files in the repository. The links are correct for what's shown, but not what is described in the URL.

For instance:

http://bitbucket.org/offline/django-tsearch2/src/tip/setup.py

Is showing the contents of:

http://bitbucket.org/offline/django-tsearch2/src/tip/tsearch2/signals.py

On the setup.py page, the links for things like the raw version are pointing to the signals.py file.

My OpenID is  http://crowd.parkingmapper.com/openidserver/users/david . However, when I choose this OpenID for association, BitBucket just prompts me for my BitBucket credentials again and then spits me back onto my default page. The association does not happen.
fields.summary: Cannot associate OpenID with my account

fields.description:
Please provide details of how to checkout a BitBucket repository using Subversion, as per the Plans page which states:

*Subversion*

Your repositories can be accessed via subversion. You can even commit to them.
fields.summary: Subversion access to hg repos does not work, gives a message about 'please relocate' (BB-888)

fields.description:
pulling from https://xunta:***@bitbucket.org/xunta/xts_development/\\
HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error\\
[command interrupted]

I cant pull my repo at the moment, but when I try to pull another repo (http://bitbucket.org/ellislab/codeigniter/), it works well.

So I just wondering, do the free plan and Vip plan have different backend servers? and the VIP is more stable? is that right?

thanks!

Hi, we're getting a HTPP Error 500: Internal Server Error response when we try to pull on the following repo:\\
https://bitbucket.org/ABCRadio/abcopen

We've had this happen before and you managed to fix it fairly rapidly, but I was wondering if there was anything we can do from our end to clear this?

Cheers,\\
Sam
I'm getting a 403 error while trying to login to bitbucket via the website.  CSRF toekn error.  Looks like Debug is set to true in your settings file

Probably a caching issue.

I followed a repository and when I tried to find it several hours later it was not in my list of followed repositories. I managed to reproduce it easily by un-following a project, checking my homepage and the repository was still there. Then I followed a different repository and it never showed up.
fields.summary: Following sidebar in home page not updating.

fields.description: i remove all my folder, but always appears that i have a pm. i remove my browser cache, i try with another browser but I have not been lucky
fields.summary: i have 1 pm, but my folder is empty

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I noticed the changelog of the wiki pages is sorted in a very funny way. There is no indication of it being sorted consistently ascending or descending on date or rev number. The pages I look at are at http://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/wiki/history/Home. All the history is there, which is verifiable by cloning the repo of those pages localy. But when you click the little "history" button at the top of a wiki page, that changelog does not show the most recent cset at the top, as could be expected. And as was the case till some weeks ago. This is rather annoying when somenone wants to look at the separate recent changes via the web.\\
Could someone look into this please ?

Hi,

I wanted to add an image to the wiki and looked checked the FAQ and followed the instructions. But it doesn't display the image. When i access the generated URL i get an "Internal server error" page.

see here: http://bytebucket.org/mtoader/google-go-for-idea-docs/wiki/screenshot1.gif.

If clone the repository i see that the file i there.

At some point i had a merge conflict on the wiki tree and i managed to reconcile it.

To be more specific if i clone my repository and look at it with hg glog command i see something like this (look at the output.glog attachment) and the same thing happens if i clone and check another repository (like https://mtoader@bitbucket.org/snej/murky/wiki), same behaviour on the web ( not image display ) same history as mine.

if i look at another repository (see https://mtoader@bitbucket.org/ronw/gordon/wiki) the glog command will show no bifurcations and the image is properly displayed on the web.

Home it helps.

Mihai
fields.summary: When you make (by mistake) a branch on the wiki repository some changes aren't picked up anymore. (BB-756)
